segments.text: This entire situation is driving me a little mad, honestly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can one person be so completely oblivious to her surroundings?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, creating a veritable indoor pond.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her feet are practically swimming, and she's just polishing a plate!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And then, the children! They are taking full advantage of her distraction.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall off that stool; it's a certainty.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What a mess that will make, right on top of the water puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just so completely out of control.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me want to step in and just turn off that faucet myself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to intervene before everything goes completely wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sheer lack of awareness is almost painful to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're all just in their own little worlds.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kitchen is a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
